properties.Osborne: On the east slope of Cape Pakhys 'an ancient fort'. Baker-Penoyre 229.
properties.Name: Marmora.

properties.Osborne:
The cape is heavily overgrown. There are pines directly to the east but olives on the
coastal plain to the south. Clear view to Cape Pakhys to the north and along the coast south. Tower not
found and dimensions unknown. BCH 85 (1961) 940
properties.Name: Akrotiri cape

properties.Osborne: On the point immediately south of a quarry where the rock has been cut down to sea-level, a tower 3-5 m in diameter
properties.Name: Phanari cape

properties.Osborne:
On the south side of the bay a tower 10.2 x 9.9 m with associated stairway and terracing.
The tower stands to some 2 m on the lower side, with a foundation levelling course and parpens above.
properties.Name: Saliari.

properties.Osborne:
On the cape a tower 5.2 m in diameter preserved to a metre high. From this tower
comes the inscription in late Archaic lettering suggesting that it served some sort of warning function for
sailors...
properties.Name: Pyrgos

properties.Osborne:
About 2 km south of Potamia, a tower 9.62 x 9.62 m of well-dressed ashlar blocks. Now
very heavily overgrown with brushwood but excavated by Bon who found evidence for a late fourth- or
early third-century date...
properties.Name: Helleniko

properties.Osborne:
Some 50 m from the tip of the cape a tower 10.3 x 6.3 m, of which only the foundations are preserved, in a court. There is a light scatter of sherds both in the area of the tower and higher up the
point...  Autopsy.Bon I6o-I.
properties.Name: Gravousa

properties.Osborne:
South of Kinyra, at the rear of the plain between two ravines a tower 7 x 7 m. The tower
appears not to be visible today, and may possibly be concealed by the modern road...
properties.Name: Loutro.

properties.Osborne:
On hill at south end of Kinyra bay a circular basis some i o m in diameter. Apparently on a
slope now covered in pines and much cut about by modern tracks. Baker-Penoyre 234, Bon 162.
properties.Name: Loutro.

properties.Osborne:
On the east side of the bay further back from the sea than the square tower to
the west a round defence work about I o m in diameter. For the general situation, see no. i. Baker-Penoyre
235, Bon 163.
properties.Name: Aghios Nikolaos bay

properties.Osborne:
A tower of Io x I o m lies on the west side of the bay at
the very edge of the cliff. Only the lowest course remains. There is a commanding view over the bay but no
further...
properties.Name: Aghios Nikolaos

properties.Osborne: Yvon Garlan tells me that there is a quadrangular tower on this cape.
properties.Name: Babouras cape

properties.Osborne:
In the middle of traces of quarrying, I km west of Aliki, a tower 9 x 9 m. This is the site
of a Byzantine village. The tower is substantially built and survives to a height of almost 2 m...
properties.Name: Skhidia

properties.Osborne:
On the spur projecting from the hill range to the west a tower of c.20 m diameter
standing to more than 3 m high...
properties.Name: Thymonia

properties.Osborne:
On the point east of Vathy Potamia bay and immediately west of Moni
Arkhangelou a tower 7.6 m in diameter preserved to three courses of well-shaped stones with some further
fallen stones...
properties.Name: Vathy Potamia

properties.Osborne:
At west end of ridge of hills due east of Astris a marble tower 7.5 x 8.0 m preserved to
some 2 m high. The tower not only has a spectacular view over the whole south-west tip of the island...
properties.Name: Amygdalia

properties.Osborne:
In the middle of the bay just behind the beach a tower of which one side is revealed in
the bank of the track leading down to the sea...
properties.Name: Kalami bay

properties.Osborne:
In the village forming the foundations for a house, a tower 9.9 x i 1.6 m. The tower is on rising
ground but not at the top of the slope...
properties.Name: Astris

properties.Osborne:
On the steep slope on the north side of a dry valley which leads a crooked way down to
the valley in which Avatsinia lies, a tower 8 x 8 m...
properties.Name: Stin Trypiti.

properties.Osborne:
North of the cape, on hill south of Astris bay, a tower 9 x 14 m of local ironstone. If
correctly identified this tower lies close to the modern triangulation point and only one or two blocks mark...
properties.Name: Kokkina

properties.Osborne:
In valley north of Astris running down to the north of the bay of Astris, and about
2 km from the sea, a tower 8 x 8 m in a court 30 x 23 m ...
properties.Name: Avatsinia

properties.Osborne:
In valley leading north-east from Psili Ammos, on hill to south of valley a tower
7.5 x 5 m at the corner of an enclosure 26 x 13 m...
properties.Name: Kaminorokhaïko

properties.Osborne:
Some distance from the sea at the foot of a hill at the south-west of the plain a tower
I6.3 x 17.8 m. Conze 34-
properties.Name: Potos

properties.Osborne: North of the road to Theologo a tower 8.8 x 9.9 m. Conze 35.
properties.Name: Potos

properties.Osborne:
Above the beach a tower 9 x 9 m. Note that an amphora atelier is also known from the
middle of Limenaria. Conze 38, AM 33 (19o8) 240.
properties.Name: Limenaria

properties.Osborne:
In the broad valley south of Skala Maries, on an eminence claimed to dominate the whole
area south to Cape Kephalas, a tower 9.4 x 9.4 m amid abandoned terracing and a heavy scatter of sherds...
properties.Name: Phari.

properties.Osborne:
In valley south of Skala Maries a tower 9 m in diameter. Conze 38. See general remarks for
no. 17
properties.Name: Phari

properties.Osborne:
Half an hour before arriving at the village a tower 13.5 x 10.75 m on the west slope of a
gentle hill. Long thin blocks with larger blocks above. The imprecision of the directions did not allow this
tower to be traced on the ground. Bon 165-7 with plan
properties.Name: Theologo.

properties.Osborne:
on road from Skala Maries to Maries. A gneiss tower Io x 10 m, of which only two
corners and the lowest course of one side are now visible, lies on a slight natural eminence on the north
bank of the stream running from Maries to the sea...
properties.Name: Aghios Vassilis

properties.Osborne:
In the valley leading up from Prinos to Kasaviti, just to the south of the modern road
about 2 km before Mikro Kasaviti a gneiss tower 8.o x 8.8 m...
properties.Name: Tsouknidha.

properties.Osborne:
A deserted medieval village on the path from Kasaviti to Rakhoni (now no longer in use)
includes a tower 9.4 x 9.4 m of large blocks in irregular courses. This is now in pine forest. Bon 175-7-
properties.Name: Ovraio.
